cards.name: Pack Rat
cards.text:
Pack Rat's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Rats you control.
{2}{B}, Discard a card: Create a token that's a copy of Pack Rat.

rulings.text: If Pack Rat leaves the battlefield before its activated ability resolves, the token will still enter the battlefield as a copy of Pack Rat, using Pack Rat’s copiable values from when it was last on the battlefield.
Pack Rat’s first ability counts any creature you control with the creature type Rat, not just Pack Rats.

The token will copy Pack Rat’s two abilities. Its power and toughness will be equal to the number of Rats you control (not the number of Rats you controlled when the token entered the battlefield). It will also be able to create copies of itself.

The token won’t copy counters on Pack Rat, nor will it copy other effects that have changed Pack Rat’s power, toughness, types, color, or so on. Normally, this means the token will simply be a Pack Rat. But if any copy effects have affected that Pack Rat, they’re taken into account.

cards.name: Slum Reaper
cards.text: When Slum Reaper enters the battlefield, each player sacrifices a creature.
cards.flavor: It's sent into unguilded districts by the Orzhov to collect the souls of those no one will miss.

rulings.text: As Slum Reaper’s ability resolves, first the player whose turn it is chooses a creature they control, then each other player in turn order does the same, knowing the choices made before them. Then all the chosen creatures are sacrificed at the same time.
If any player controls no creatures, that player simply doesn’t sacrifice anything. Each other player still sacrifices a creature.
Slum Reaper may be the creature its controller sacrifices for its own ability.

cards.name: Thrill-Kill Assassin
cards.text:
Deathtouch
Unleash (You may have this creature enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. It can't block as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.)
cards.flavor: As the bounty on Massacre Girl rose, so did the number of imitators.

rulings.text: A creature with unleash can’t block if it has any +1/+1 counter on it, not just one put on it by the unleash ability.
Putting a +1/+1 counter on a creature with unleash that’s already blocking won’t remove it from combat. It will continue to block.
The unleash ability applies no matter where the creature is entering the battlefield from.

You make the choice to have the creature with unleash enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter or not as it’s entering the battlefield. At that point, it’s too late for a player to respond to the creature spell by trying to counter it, for example.

"The most impressive performances can be done only once."

rulings.text: A creature dealt damage by Annihilating Fire that dies this turn will be exiled even if it wasn’t the target of Annihilating Fire (say, because the damage was redirected somehow).
A creature dealt damage by Annihilating Fire will be exiled no matter why the creature would die. It could be destroyed by another spell or ability.
The creature can still regenerate.

cards.name: Dynacharge
cards.text:
Target creature you control gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
Overload {2}{R} (You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, change "target" in its text to "each.")
cards.flavor: Nothing evens the odds like a little lightning.

rulings.text: Because a spell with overload doesn’t target when its overload cost is paid, it may affect permanents with hexproof or with protection from the appropriate color.
Casting a spell with overload doesn’t change that spell’s mana cost. You just pay the overload cost instead.
Effects that cause you to pay more or less for a spell will cause you to pay that much more or less while casting it for its overload cost, too.
If you are instructed to cast a spell with overload “without paying its mana cost,” you can’t choose to pay its overload cost instead.
If you don’t pay the overload cost of a spell, that spell will have a single target. If you pay the overload cost, the spell won’t have any targets.
Note that if the spell with overload is dealing damage, protection from that spell’s color will still prevent that damage.
Overload doesn’t change when you can cast the spell.
An overloaded Dynacharge affects only creatures you control at the time it resolves. Creatures you begin to control later in the turn won’t get +2/+0.

cards.name: Gore-House Chainwalker
cards.text: Unleash (You may have this creature enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. It can't block as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.)
cards.flavor: If the pig's blood drips on you, you're next on the chain.

rulings.text: A creature with unleash can’t block if it has any +1/+1 counter on it, not just one put on it by the unleash ability.
Putting a +1/+1 counter on a creature with unleash that’s already blocking won’t remove it from combat. It will continue to block.
The unleash ability applies no matter where the creature is entering the battlefield from.

You make the choice to have the creature with unleash enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter or not as it’s entering the battlefield. At that point, it’s too late for a player to respond to the creature spell by trying to counter it, for example.

cards.originalText: Unleash (You may have this creature enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. It can't block as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.name: Guild Feud
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, target opponent reveals the top three cards of their library, may put a creature card from among them onto the battlefield, then puts the rest into their graveyard. You do the same with the top three cards of your library. If two creatures are put onto the battlefield this way, those creatures fight each other.

rulings.text: Any abilities that trigger when the two creatures enter the battlefield will be put on the stack after the fight, even if one or both creatures die.

Guild Feud has one target: the opponent. You’ll see what creature that player puts onto the battlefield before revealing the top three cards of your library and deciding whether to put a creature onto the battlefield yourself.
If no creatures or only one creature is put onto the battlefield this way, no fight happens.
Players can’t cast spells or activate abilities between the creatures being put onto the battlefield and them fighting each other. Notably, you can’t respond with a spell like Giant Growth.

foreignNames.name: Gildenfehde
foreignNames.text: Zu Beginn deines Versorgungssegments deckt ein Gegner deiner Wahl die obersten drei Karten seiner Bibliothek auf. Er kann eine Kreaturenkarte davon ins Spiel bringen. Dann legt er den Rest dieser Karten auf seinen Friedhof. Du tust das Gleiche mit den obersten drei Karten deiner Bibliothek. Falls auf diese Weise zwei Kreaturen ins Spiel gebracht werden, kämpfen diese Kreaturen gegeneinander.

foreignNames.name: Disputa entre gremios
foreignNames.text: Al comienzo de tu mantenimiento, el oponente objetivo muestra las primeras tres cartas de su biblioteca y puede poner en el campo de batalla una carta de criatura que se encuentre entre ellas, luego pone el resto en su cementerio. Tú haces lo mismo con las tres primeras cartas de tu biblioteca. Si dos criaturas son puestas en el campo de batalla de este modo, esas criaturas luchan entre sí.

foreignNames.name: Lutte entre guildes
foreignNames.text: Au début de votre entretien, l'adversaire ciblé révèle les trois cartes du dessus de sa bibliothèque, il peut mettre une carte de créature parmi elles sur le champ de bataille, puis met les autres dans son cimetière. Vous faites la même chose avec les trois cartes du dessus de votre bibliothèque. Si deux créatures sont mises sur le champ de bataille de cette manière, elles se battent l'une contre l'autre.

foreignNames.name: Faida della Gilda
foreignNames.text: All'inizio del tuo mantenimento, un avversario bersaglio rivela le prime tre carte del suo grimorio. Può mettere sul campo di battaglia una carta creatura scelta tra esse, poi mette le altre nel suo cimitero. Fai lo stesso con le prime tre carte del tuo grimorio. Se due creature vengono messe sul campo di battaglia in questo modo, lottano l'una con l'altra.

foreignNames.name: ギルドの抗争
foreignNames.text: あなたのアップキープの開始時に、対戦相手１人を対象とする。そのプレイヤーは自分のライブラリーの一番上から３枚のカードを公開する。そのプレイヤーはそれらのカードの中からクリーチャー・カードを１枚戦場に出してもよい。その後残りを自分の墓地に置く。あなたもあなたのライブラリーの一番上から３枚のカードについて同様にする。これにより２体のクリーチャーが戦場に出た場合、それらのクリーチャーは互いに格闘を行う。

foreignNames.name: 길드 간의 분쟁
foreignNames.text: 당신의 유지단 시작에, 상대 한 명을 목표로 정한다. 그 상대는 자신의 서고 맨 위의 카드 세 장을 공개하고, 그 중 생물 카드 한 장을 전장에 놓을 수 있다. 그런 다음 나머지 카드는 자신의 무덤에 넣는다. 당신도 당신의 서고 맨 위의 카드 세 장으로 똑같이 한다. 이런 방법으로 생물 두 개가 전장에 놓이면, 그 생물들은 서로 싸운다.

foreignNames.name: Contenda entre Guildas
foreignNames.text: No início de sua manutenção, o oponente alvo revela os três cards do topo do próprio grimório, pode colocar um card de criatura dentre esses no campo de batalha e, depois, coloca o restante no próprio cemitério. Você faz o mesmo com os três cards do topo do seu grimório. Se duas criaturas forem colocadas no campo de batalha dessa forma, elas lutam uma contra a outra.

foreignNames.name: Вражда Гильдий
foreignNames.text: В начале вашего шага поддержки целевой оппонент показывает три верхние карты своей библиотеки, может положить находящуюся среди них карту существа на поле битвы, затем кладет остальные карты на свое кладбище. Вы делаете то же самое с тремя верхними картами вашей библиотеки. Если таким образом на поле битвы были положены два существа, те существа дерутся друг с другом.

foreignNames.name: 公会世仇

rulings.text: Guttersnipe's triggered ability resolves before the spell that caused it to trigger. It resolves even if that spell is countered.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, Guttersnipe's ability causes the opposing team to lose 4 life.

{T}: Lobber Crew deals 1 damage to each opponent.
Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, untap Lobber Crew.

cards.name: Minotaur Aggressor
cards.text: First strike, haste
cards.flavor: The smelting district is home to many who see the guilds as not for them.

foreignNames.name: Aggressiver Minotaurus
foreignNames.text: Erstschlag, Eile
foreignNames.flavor: Im Verhüttungsdistrikt haben viele eine Heimat gefunden, die mit den Gilden nichts am Hut haben.

foreignNames.name: Agresor minotauro
foreignNames.text: Daña primero, prisa.
foreignNames.flavor: El distrito de las fundiciones es hogar de muchos que al mirar a los diez gremios dicen "no es para mí".

foreignNames.name: Agresseur minotaure
foreignNames.text: Initiative, célérité
foreignNames.flavor: Le quartier des fonderies abrite nombre de résidents qui ne sont pas intéressés par les guildes.

foreignNames.name: Minotauro Aggressivo
foreignNames.text: Attacco improvviso, rapidità
foreignNames.flavor: Il distretto della fusione è la casa di quelli che guardando alle gilde pensano: "Non fanno per me."

foreignNames.name: ミノタウルスの攻め手
foreignNames.text: 先制攻撃、速攻
foreignNames.type: クリーチャー — ミノタウルス・狂戦士
foreignNames.flavor: 精錬地区はギルドを見て合わないと感じた多くの者達の根城である。

foreignNames.name: 공격적인 미노타우로스
foreignNames.text: 선제공격, 신속
foreignNames.flavor: 제련 지구에는 길드 생활이 자신에게 맞지 않는다고 생각하는 자들이 많이 살고 있다.

foreignNames.name: Agressor Minotauro
foreignNames.text: Iniciativa, ímpeto
foreignNames.flavor: O distrito das fundições é lar de muitos que olham para as dez guildas e dizem "isso não é para mim".

foreignNames.name: Минотавр-Агрессор
foreignNames.text: Первый удар, Ускорение
foreignNames.flavor: В районе плавильщиков живут те, кто не хочет вступать ни в одну из гильдий.

foreignNames.name: 侵略牛头怪
foreignNames.text: 先攻，敏捷
foreignNames.flavor: 矿石提炼区是不愿加入公会者的居所。

foreignNames.name: 侵略牛頭怪
foreignNames.text: 先攻，敏捷
foreignNames.flavor: 礦石提煉區是不願加入公會者的居所。
